lab2Files

Class CSCD211Lab2Methods

  • java.lang.Object
    • lab2Files.CSCD211Lab2Methods

  • public class CSCD211Lab2Methods
extends Object
    The methods class for the Lab 2 methods that you must write

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • addBook

        public static Book[] addBook(Book[] array,
                             Book book)
        The addBook method adds a book to the array increasing the size of the array by one. The array is then sorted in ascending order by calling the selectionSort method.
        Parameters:
        array - Representing the Book array
        book - Representing the Book to be added to the array
        Returns:
        temp - Representing the new array one larger filled with the books from the old array, plus the new book. The array is sorted in ascending order.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the array or the book are null

      • createBook

        public static Book createBook(Scanner kb)
        The createBook method prompts the user for the information in a book and creates a Book object.
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        Book - Representing a Book object
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the Scanner object is null

      • getGenre

        public static Genre getGenre(String g)
        The getGenre method converts a String into a Genre. If the string does not contain a genre the default genre of FICTION is returned.
        Parameters:
        g - Representing the String to be converted to a Genre
        Returns:
        Genre - Representing the Genre
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the String is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the String is empty

      • fillArray

        public static Book[] fillArray(Scanner fin)
        The fillArray method reads from a file creates a Book object and puts that Book object into the array.
        Parameters:
        fin - Representing a Scanner object to the File
        Returns:
        Book [] - Representing the filled Book array
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the Scanner object is null

      • menu

        public static int menu(Scanner kb)
        The menu method. Valid menu choices are:
        1. Print the books to the screen
        2. Print the books to a file
        3. Sort the book using compareTo
        4. Sort the books by first author as a Comparator
        5. Add a book
        6. Quit
        You must ensure the value entered is within range

        NOTE: The carriage return is cleaned from the input buffer
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        int - Representing the menu choice
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the Scanner object is null

      • printBooks

        public static void printBooks(Book[] array,
                              PrintStream fout)
        The printBooks method prints the array one book at a time to the specified PrintStream. Each book is separated by a carriage return.
        Parameters:
        array - Representing the array of Books
        fout - Representing the PrintStream object for the file or the screen
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either the array or the PrintStream object are null

      • readFileName

        public static String readFileName(Scanner kb)
        The readFileName method reads the name of hte output file from the keyboard. The carriage return is cleaned.
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        String - Representing the name of the output file
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the Scanner object is null
